metadata.title: Thursday, 25th February, 2016
metadata.session: FIFTH SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

parts: (a)    what progress has been made on the holding of the referendum, to amend the Bill of Rights, simultaneously with the general elections on 11th August, 2016; and
(b)    whether the public has been educated on the referendum, considering that such an exercise has not been held in Zambia in a long time.
(a)    whether the Government has any plans to degazette the Game Management Area in Chief Machiya’s area in Mpongwe Parliamentary Constituency;
(b)    if so, when the plans will be implemented; and
(c)    if there are no such plans, why. QUESTION FOR WRITTEN ANSWER W17    Mr Mbewe (Chadiza) - to ask the Minister of General Education:
(a)    how many times the Zambian education curricula for primary and secondary schools have been revised from 1964 to-date;
(b)    what the rationale for the revisions at each stage was; and
(c)    what subjects were affected by the revisions.
